chain chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook single_crochet single_crochet insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch yarn over and pull through both loops on hook pattern notes the scarf is worked in long row of single_crochet stitches in us terms you can adjust the length of your scarf by adjusting the number of chains you begin with any number of chains works for this pattern the scarf sample started with 201 chains shorter scarf variation chain 151 to make 150 single_crochet stitches in row 1 the finished scarf would be about 79 5 long 202 cm and about 12 wide 30 5 cm if you use one whole cake of yarn 481 yards/440 m very short wide shawl variation chain 101 to make 100 single_crochet stitches in row 1 the finished scarf would be about 53 long 135 cm and 17 inches wide 43 cm if you use one whole cake of yarn 481 yards/440 m unwind scarf pattern chain 201 row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and all chain across 200 single_crochet stitches row 2-24 or until the yarn runs out chain 1 does not count as a st single_crochet in each st across 200 single_crochet stitches per row fasten_off and weave in the ends share your scarf with #unwindscarf on
